website_summaries.verdict: With a sizable Lithium ion battery, it delivers reliable power for a sustained period and recharges in an hour. Those who do fine-detail work might find it too heavy, but with great portability and 32,000 rpm, it's a great tool for general use.
pros: Powerful enough to cut ceramic tile
EZ Twist Nose Cap eliminates the need for a wrench to tighten accessories onto the tool
Lithium ion battery holds a charge well, and motor runs fairly quietly
cons: Might be too heavy for fine-detail work
Some frustration with EZ Twist Nose Cap
Some reports of smoke coming from charger when battery first plugged in

customer_reviews.title: A tool you need
customer_reviews.text: I like the Dremel 8220-1/28 12-Volt Max. I use it a lot for cutting off screws, etc. that are sticking out of things that I am working with (such as screws through rough cabinet doors, barn doors, etc.). I also use it often to sharpen the chain on my saw. I would have the Dremel for that use alone. It cuts way down on the time and effort involved in sharpening the chains. I get the correct size bit and the job is done in minutes. This also saves money on professional sharpening. Since this is a cordless model, I can take it out into the woods with me and use it as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Supplied collet will not fit attachments !!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in December but haven't needed to use it until just now in March only to find out that none of the supplied attachments will fit into the provided collet !!! It does not come with a secondary collet so my project will have to wait 3 days to recieve a collet that will work because I am over 100 miles from a town that will have it. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't include everything that you need!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit thinking that it had everything that I needed. However, I was very disappointed to learn that I needed a different collet or the MultiPro Keyless Chuck (part #4486), neither of which were included, in order to use the sander accessories. I had to run to Home Depot to buy the Keyless Chuck for another $11. This part should be included with the kit, or AT LEAST be VERY CLEAR ***on the packaging*** that you additionally need to buy a particular collet or the Keyless Chuck to use which accessories in the kit. For a better customer experience, include the Chuck in the kit for free (or add $5 to the cost of the kit).
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this device and I'm happy I made this purchase. I did a lot of research trying to determine which one was best for my application and I'm happy I choose this Dremel. It's really an excellent work horse - I use it in the field on our raceway all the time. Its durable, I throw it in my tool box and have never had an issue with it. The battery once charged lasts a long time and the tool has a great feel in my hand to it.
customer_reviews.author: Pete & Lilly

customer_reviews.title: The best of my many Dremels
customer_reviews.text: I have worn out a few 110v dremels, and had several battery power ones that had minimal power or lower RPM. (5v & 7.4v). If you will use this tool over 1 hour per year, I'd go with this fantastic 12 volt one. No need to have a plug in model if you have this very powerful 12 v battery model. The last few months I've been using this for maybe 3 hrs per week for grinding, shaping, sanding & polishing. It's my favorite by far. If you are doing long hard sessions (over 30 min) an extra battery can give you nonstop high power grinding. (If you polish stainless, go buy a bar of green jewelry polish)
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool with Flex Shaft for trimming dog nails!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the 7700 model which mainly was used to trim my dog's nails. We also had a really old electric Dremel which seemed too powerful for the dog and was also in need of repair. So I splurged with the 225-01 Flex shaft and I have to say nail trimming is now a breeze. The handle of the flex shaft is light weight and easy to manipulate to get at the correct angle for the dog nail. My dog's nails were too long when I got her so I am trying to get them back to a healthy length by trimming at least every two weeks. This tool will make it less stressful for us both.
customer_reviews.author: GayleB

customer_reviews.title: Its awesome
customer_reviews.text: There really isn't much you cannot do with this. I really think it is great . As a woman without a shed full of power tools I find this with a few add ons I bought fills my needs for all my projects around the house and I can get rid of my worthless husband.
customer_reviews.author: frog princess

customer_reviews.title: Cordless multitool done right.
customer_reviews.text: Dremel quality always rocks. Not the cheapest multi tool but worth the extra. I was swayed away and tried a Milwaukee and the speed switch failed within 2 months. I'm a heavy user. (RC car racer / fabricator since 87) I'm on dremel number 4 from wearing out bearings and brushes.. By far the nicest cordless I've had. A cordless that will keep up with a corded model for a decent time. Always want it to last longer on battery life... But.... Nature of a battery tool
customer_reviews.author: Brad F.

customer_reviews.title: After 36 days the on/off switch started malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: I just can't go over 2 stars right now but depending on how warrantee is handled I will adjust it upwards or downwards. I loved this Dremel tool for the short time that it worked properly. Right now though I have to turn it on and off and back on several times in order to get it to start up. It was delivered on Jan 23rd and so I just missed Amazons 30 day return window on it. I called Amazons product support and they are going to put me in touch with the manufacturer support next week. I will update this review then. Update: 5 stars for the ease of an exchange after the sale
customer_reviews.author: Usalf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my birthday, instructions are a little vague on the accessories changing. But there's always you tube for that. My husband put up a security screen door. The kind with the bolts that don't come out.he used up 2 sawzaw blades trying to cut them off, & ran out of dewalt battery power. When he went to go get another battery.i got out my dremel with the cutting blade. Had the bolt off before ,he got back with the battery! Ha big things do come in small packages! Just wish it came in Pink so no one else would want to use it!
customer_reviews.author: plowgirl

customer_reviews.text: Charger Never work for me when i plug it it smoke and never charged any batteries ... and tried to contact dremel support one guy reply to me said send me your location i will send new charger and then ignored me no charger so tool now not working sience that batteries finish cant recharge them cus of that charger issue Burned on 1st use im really sad about it so its very bad thing to waste money on it and no warranty for replace .. its first use imagine you want to charge batteries and u see smoke this what will happen for you if you buy that
customer_reviews.author: Alkthery

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy But Battery Is Extremely Weak.  Update, got a spare with twice the juice
customer_reviews.text: The Jewish T-Rex just seemed appropriate somehow. Should have known better and purchased a Milwaukee. I get about half an hour run time at best and the battery is DONE. That's after an exchange because the first one was even worse. Quality, like everything in the world now isn't as good. Ran my corded Dremel into the ground but it took 10 years. I give this one 6 1/2 months at most.
customer_reviews.author: Hepsiebaw Mchorselstrapp

customer_reviews.title: Dremolition...
customer_reviews.text: I really was excited to have this tool and I bought a lot of attachments and replacement disc... but, the variable speed quit working 2 months after purchase. I thought the tool was going to be a lifetime purchase and I've got to say I'm very disappointed. This is not the lower-priced smaller units this is the premium top of the line tool. Variable speed is a must for Tool control!
customer_reviews.author: Minding my time

customer_reviews.title: Always been a fan
customer_reviews.text: I've had a corded Dremel for many years and I doubt that I'd get much done in my garage and studio without it. I decided to buy a cordless to make my life easier. Although I've found both cord and cordless to be rated for the same RPM, the corded model has much more torque and with some accessories does a better job, like cutting. I find the cordless is better for my needs when I'm doing light cutting, polishing, grinding etc.
customer_reviews.author: Hard T. PleaseTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Its a Dremel
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool a lot as a Locksmith. I have 6 rotary tools for shop use but this one always goes with me on jobs. You won't miss the power of a corded Dremel with this one. I mostly use it with carbide burrs and cutting wheels . The collet that works as a wrench is on of the best improvements because I'm always misplacing the tiny wrench that comes with them. The battery hold enough charge that I rarely need a spare battery and the remaining power LED indicator lets me know when its time to recharge before a job. The only minor complaint I have is the tightness of the battery pack in the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.Mad !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tool on Black Friday, saved $25. Too bad I had to return it. Right out of the box, it’s working but making rattling noise, sounds like bad bearings or the shaft rubbing with the outer skin. Amazon sent me a replacement but again same defect. Dremel, do you have quality control at your factories? I’ll try Milwaukee next.
customer_reviews.author: My Viet Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need for my large dog's nails.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a large dog's nails, seems to hold a charge long enough. I plan to use a couple of times a week, lightly, rather than have to subject the dog to longer sessions. I read that it's important to move quickly from nail to nail so it doesn't get hot, but it hasn't seemed to be much of a problem. I practiced on my own nails first (they have a strong gel, I don't know about this for natural nails), to learn how to hold it. It charges quickly enough for me and I like the variable speed. Instructions are clear, no problem putting it together or changing the tip. Might use this for some legit woodwork, even.
customer_reviews.author: sandyb

customer_reviews.title: Dremel 8220 12-volt cordless model is Best Dremel yet
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Dremel model for a few weeks now. The 12 volts provides longer time between charges and I like the variable speed controller - which I didn't have with my older model. So far, this model is working great and I love. Definitely cheaper than picking one up at Lowes which is about $20 buck more. Also, I purchased the Asurion 4 yr protection plan extended warranty which I might add is much less than Lowes version. No complaints so far... I would recommend this Dremel for those who need mobility and cordless models.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even come with the right size Collett for the tools in it
customer_reviews.text: this is ridiculous none of Extensions that came with it even fit. You have to go and buy another "collet" Absolutely ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: joe v.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and cordless makes it even better
customer_reviews.text: In the past I have not had great luck with battery operated tools but that was before Lithium batteries were widely used. I had another brand of corded rotary tool that finally died. So when I decided to replace it, I looked into this one. This tool seems to have plenty of power and the battery lasts a long time. The only thing I would say that is less than ideal is the physical size of the tool. It's a little bit larger diameter and a little longer than my previous rotary tool. I use rotary tools a lot and have gone through two of them before I got this one. Hopefully it will keep working for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reischel

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: This dremel fills every need! It is easy to use, easy to change,and easy to charge. I love the adjustable speeds and not havong to constantly reposition myself or an object inorder to maneuver around the cord is the best! Of all the rotary tools I have used in my life this is by far my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Megan C.

customer_reviews.title: Not performing
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this tool the first day. After a couple charges there is a strange and strong vibration coming from the tool. The worst of all is that the tool just turns off even if it is fully charged based on the light indicators on the tool. This is the second battery operated Dremel that lets me down. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: TonySqrd

customer_reviews.title: Charger not compatible in my LOCATION
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this Dremel 8220-2/28 along with other accessories but the charger supplied is 120V ONLY and not 220-240V that I required. Tried to contact Amazon but the only solution for them is to return the item which is not convenient on my side at all for I have to pay the return and wait for the refund for days instead of focusing with the specific issue and provide better solution. If the Dremel is reading this if possible please send the correct charger with 220-240 voltage for the battery to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Get two batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I burned up my old Dremel 8100 that I loved and would swear by.vThe replacement is nice but am very disappointed in battery work time. Seems like my old one lasted twice as long. I will probably order a second battery because of this problem. That is a bit vexing as there is always more money to spend but I hate being interrupted in the middle of a project. Other than the battery problem, the new singular off/on switch makes it easier and every thing else seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Henry

customer_reviews.title: terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: battery lasted 10 minutes second charge 15 it got very hot. after third charge wouldn't turn on and battery was warm when I removed it out it back in and unit for warm while it was off and wouldn't turn back on. I returned for a replacement as I always liked previous deemed tools. It is very heavy so I used it with flex shaft. I'm hoping new one will work as tool is well made and the few minutes it worked was great for removing rust! Will update if new one has a better battery life!
customer_reviews.author: RK Clark

customer_reviews.title: Scam... it’s used
customer_reviews.text: This product I bought new but was used when it arrived. Also came with absolutely no attachments. Total scam.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: First rotary tool for me and I'm very pleased. Easy operation. Flexible attachments to fit any need. I've used it to route out a channel to inlay a magnet, cut plexiglass sheeting, and sand for shaping. Next use is for cleaning and polishing straight razor blades. A great tool to have available for many, many projects.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Levis

customer_reviews.title: remove battery
customer_reviews.text: Just received today - 4 March 2019 . . .The tool seems to work very well - - EXCEPT WHEN THE BATTERY NEEDS TO BE REMOVED for charging ! ! I would give this 5 stars, but the battery requires using some sort of a channel lock wrench to depress the two points to remove it. I am not a 90 lb weakling, but find it next to impossible to depress the two clips that allow the battery to be removed. I'm seriously thinking about grinding down the locking clips but that would probably void the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ozarks Hermit

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and smooth variable speed almost makes me want to break something just so I can fix it.
customer_reviews.text: Considering this is probably the seventh Dremel product I've owned during the last 30 years I and many were used for work anyone reading this review should know it is experience driven. I'm very tough on my tools when needed and I take great care of those that serve. This newest generation of Dremel is a must have. You get all the benefits from the broad range of tools plus a lot more power and battery life. The tool is heavier and a little bulky but for a large project or lots of little ones over time it fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Inventor

customer_reviews.title: Like a idiot I have broken down the box
customer_reviews.text: Unit came with 1/16 inch collet. Tools that came with the unit require 1/8 inch collet which is what the box says is supplied. Not knowing this I made a 30 mile roundtrip trip to get a Tungsten Carbide Cutter from Loews. This tool requires a 1/8 inch collet. The unit is worthless as supplied unless I purchase the collet. Like a idiot I have broken down the box.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis E. Garner

customer_reviews.title: Great kit and value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool and value! I have wanted to upgrade my dremel that I purchased about 8 years ago. I am glad I spent the extra money and went with this cordless tool and kit instead. This has plenty of power for most jobs that I foresee. The battery life has been great and honestly, not having to maneuver the cord for detail work has proven very useful already! This is a great tool and kit. Having the extra battery is great.
customer_reviews.author: Andy R.

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Dremel
customer_reviews.text: My hubby has a very old model that he used for years. We purchased this one to replace his outdated model for his use and for me to trim our larger dogs nails. It works great for the dogs!! I was able to trim my Aussie's nails without him getting distressed. He usually is not a fan of getting his nails trimmed, but he didn't mind this at all! He actually fell asleep while I was doing it. Sorry I didn't purchase one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: ATL ladyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: This cordless Dremel works as expected. Very useful for those projects where no electricity is available. My only suggestion...buy a second battery. If your battery runs out, you’ll have to wait quit some time before you can continue that project. If the kit came with a second battery, I’d of given it a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherEarthling

customer_reviews.title: What can't it do?
customer_reviews.text: Combine with a box of attachments, and this thing becomes a perfect household tool. Considering that most of the Chuck and Mandrel sets work great with my power drill also, there's really no downside. This thing is so great! Sanding, grinding, cutting, and just general fooling around are enjoyable. It's got a comfortable grip, great battery life, and easy recharge setup.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchum

customer_reviews.title: I use industrial die grinders daily on super steels, aluminum and titanium
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for personal use but am very impressed, especially for the price. Excellent run time, surprising power, nice bomb-proof case and decent starter accessories. This lacks the refinement of my Cooper Tools Dotco 40k RPM motor at speeds above 15k rpm but it makes up for that with excellent power delivery at shaft, just as smooth in its own (electric) way in gradiation, and not having a cord/hose attached to the back end.
customer_reviews.author: Rchiwawa

customer_reviews.title: I have a Great Dane whose nails are huge
customer_reviews.text: Had a dremel around for years. Last year mine finally died and I hadn't seen the need to replace, until I heard about ising one to trim my digs nails. I have a Great Dane whose nails are huge. He's about four and those nails are getting harder and hard to find a nail clipper big enough to trim them - so I ordered the Dremel. It's working great, but today I had occasion to use it for a construction project and was really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: SDRAHCIR R.

customer_reviews.title: Photo not representational of product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product from Amazon as it was a great deal based on the accessories it came with, mainly the cutting detachment pictured in the photo. The full set of accessories were not part of the actual product purchased, Be aware the photo does not represent what your actually get, the Dremel tool works great and the cordless option is a great step up over the previous corded one its replacing,
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Battery release impossible, sanding drum attachment not there
customer_reviews.text: I cannot remove the battery to charge it: is there a tool I can use to squeeze? My hands are not weak, but this is impossible. ALSO: I bought this to use the sanding bands, BUT there is NO mandrel/drum that the sanding band fits around. There IS one that is about 1/8" too wide but hey, why give me sanding bands when there is no way to attach them? Do I have go buy another part? This is unacceptable. Totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: anne robinson

customer_reviews.title: Bought for dog paws
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dogs nails, it comes with multiple heads. I bought one for the dogs nails but ended up preferring the sand paper ones that it comes with. IT can be a bit awkward to hold for small detail or small paws. I like that you can adjust the motor speed. The battery is not as spectacular as I would have thought, so buy the second battery option.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Did not come with a battery why?
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today, unpacked it to find that there is no battery! """ Kit contains 28 accessories, carrying case, 1-hour charger, and one 12V max lithium-ion battery "" Did this change? There is a place to put a battery in the Dremel tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Tim

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size collet
customer_reviews.text: The tools in the kit are for a 1/8" collet and the only collet supplied is a 1/16". 3 stars off for the carelessness. Now I have to get another collet.
customer_reviews.author: Vetbird

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I reluctantly had to replace my small cordless 7.5V Dremel which was very old. I didn't like the idea of getting a larger unit. But after reviewing the advantages of this Dremel, I purchased it. I'm glad I did! This is a very good tool with the variable speed and convenient On/Off switch. It is POWERFUL! It's main use is to drill holes for box nails in my steam toy table top. Not much of a challenge there. But what surprised me was that it could be used like a router to make rectangular holes in particle board. I will also be using it to make prototype printed circuit boards using number size drill bits. I highly recommend this Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: Lennie's Island

customer_reviews.title: Ideal rotary tool
customer_reviews.text: i think the Dremel name and reputation speaks for itself. this package comes with the standard bits and tips..comes in it's own case for easy and convenient storage...comes with two batteries, so yo can always have one charging while in use. I recommend this to complement your unit:
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought this long time ago! Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use my Dremel tools all the time as they are really handy for lots of stuff. I have the smaller Dremel cordless and it always stalls with any load. I thought I would give this bigger Dremel cordless a try based on the positive reviews. It really works great and does not stall although it might slow down a little but just up the speed a little to compensate. Battery life is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. ROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: The only one I use
customer_reviews.text: I've had both corded and cordless Dremel tools for years. The cordless models have always been restricted to light duty use due to lack of power. No longer. This Dremel is MORE powerful than my corded model. Other than it being a bit heavy for prolonged use, I no longer even use my corded Dremel. This thing is amazing. Great power and terrific battery life. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Frank K.

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this unit primarily as a unit to trim toenails on our dogs.
customer_reviews.text: We had an old "Tool Shop" brand rotary grinder/trimmer, but the batteries died and it is impossible to find replacement batteries, so, on to bigger & better things, this Dremel. So far it works great, except for a buzzing that I don't like from the motor. Positives: easy to use; great battery & charger system (this is the two battery set); and a nice carrying case. Negatives: That buzzing, it's a bit clumsy to use (but we expected that); the fact that the carrying case isn't quite as well designed in its interior as it could have been done.
customer_reviews.author: David Ecale

customer_reviews.title: Dremel 12-Volt Max Cordless Rotary Tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Dremel Moto Tools for many years now, can't imagine NOT having one of these tools available for use. I've also been using cordless versions for many years as well. I like the cordless versatility. This model has more power and battery life than my previous one. It is a bit larger, and heavier, but still very manageable for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: G. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Always thought dremel tools were basically useless... Until I tried this cordless unit.
customer_reviews.text: The cord kills a Dremel, how they ever built a brand around their corded product is beyond me. This product has changed my mind, besides being ergonomically questionably, it makes Dremel tools practical in real world applications where their tool size dictates precision. Must have for any composites shop.
customer_reviews.author: jgw

customer_reviews.title: Let the magic smoke out on first power-up
customer_reviews.text: It came with a battery pre-installed, as soon as I flipped the power switch smoke came out of the motor housing. Immediately removed that battery and tried the 2nd batt, even more smoke came out. Clearly shipped with a internal short, returning to Amazon for replacement. Luckily I tested it as soon as I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tool to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really used the tool yet but like to have it around having seen it used by pros for various tasks. I did allow it to break in at 5 minutes of high speed as suggested by Dremel support. Note it is pretty loud so you might want to use ear protection if used for more than a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Number1

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool.
customer_reviews.text: You can you a Dremel rotary tool for almost any work. The battery operated version (this version) is a very way to get things done when you don't have any electric plug nearby. Would definately recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: johmhoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a Dremel.
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with a Dremel. This thing should have more than enough power to do what you need. Battery lasts about 50 minutes on a full charge at 15,000rpm with a wire wheel on it. Recharge time is right around an hour. Sturdy construction, feels solid. Buy one and stop debating it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, my husband has been using it a lot for wood projects (simple cutting, nice edges, etc). Highly recommend an additional battery or 2. Next up, doing our dogs nails :)
customer_reviews.author: B's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Super Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is the Cadillac of cordless rotary tools. I had a cordless 7.2 volt Dremel for 20 years. It needed a new battery and they really didn't make them anymore. So, I checked Amazon and decided on this beauty. It's a little pricey but does it work. I highly recommend this product. There is really no comparison to my old Dremel.
customer_reviews.author: John G

customer_reviews.title: Great for Rock Tumbling
customer_reviews.text: I realize it's all about the bits, but this little guy is incredibly powerful! Pros: ・ Powerful. It can easily shape rocks at a Mohs hardness of 6.5 and up. ・ Long battery life. AND quick charging time. It also has a little light which indicates the charge. ・ Doesn't overheat. If it does get warm, I'm still easily able to hold it with bare hands. Cons: ・ Make sure you get the option with TWO batteries. Otherwise, you have to stop when the charge runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Now the bad
customer_reviews.text: I dont know why I hadnt upgraded my old Dremel earlier. Works great. Now the bad? The batteries make it about... oh.. 20 min on 3/4 speed cutting steel. That being said, It is a battery and its not like theyre really made for crazy cutting and grinding like Ive put it through. I will have to get a corded one eventually for long term heavy duty stuff but for quick heavy to just tinkering stuff, works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Been here awhile

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: I had an old school dremel, the battery wouldn't last very long and it wasn't powerful. This one has majorly imrpoved. It was quite a bit more money than the original but well worth it. I have already used it on so many projects. It is very versatile. It is nice to have 2 batteries and swap it out if it needs to be charged. It is very powerful and the charge lasts a long time. I love this dremel. Wish I got it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Em

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product with all the necessary tools for minor projects. Reliable and stable tool set. Have enough accessories for the starter kit and name brand product with solid manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: ALL4MANU

customer_reviews.title: Another great Dremel tool!
customer_reviews.text: Had a corded Dremel for years. Loved it, but when I needed to cut off a screw 100 feet from an outlet, I didn't love it as much Bought the cordless 8220-2/28 as it has more power than the cheaper models and comes with 2 batteries. No power issues - it cuts like the corded model and has good battery life. Won't buy any tool now that doesn't come with lithium ion batteries - it can sit on the shelf for months and is still charged and ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: hopewell guy

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!! Dremmel has not figured out cordless yet!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk! I used this dremmel twice and it has died. My corded one I’ve had for 5 plus years and had no problems. Of course i didn’t get around to using this until well after I could no longer return it. Very disappointed in dremmel to turn out such junk.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Has power to spare for a cordless -
customer_reviews.text: Has Power to spare for a cordless - works great for around the yard and shop chores - a little heavy if you are looking for something to do fine detail work with - you may want to stick with the electric versions. Convenient size - doesn't take up much room in the toolbox. Battery charges are fast, and run time is definitely impressive.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Yes, after reading how countless pet owners have used ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, after reading how countless pet owners have used Dremels to grind their dogs' nails, we tried a corded Dremel a couple years ago. Mind, this is on our own corns, not the Dobermann, whose ashes rest peacefully in an urn on the mantle. Cordless was enough of a convenience improvement that we retired the corded one to my work area. Now, we can do free-range toe grinding. They sell these pink non-Dremel kits for women, and they sell a clone-y knockoff at H_rb_r Fr__ght for a fraction of the price. Save the agita, get something that you know is going to work. Five stars, all day long.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ginnane

customer_reviews.title: Extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to work on projects at home and school in 2017, and it's been totally amazing! Battery life is excellent and there's hardly anything this thing doesn't back down from cutting. has a bit of weight due to the battery so holding it like a pen to do delicate work can be a bit of a pain. Otherwise, it's done everything I've asked of it.
customer_reviews.author: Le Monte Seaton

customer_reviews.title: weak battery
customer_reviews.text: The dremel rotary unit is great but the battery life is short especially when under full power. I did order another compatible brand battery with more than twice the juice to last thru the bigger jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for detailed projects
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for small projects around the house and dyi. It is kinda bulky than the corded and hard to grip but it does come in handy in places where a plug is unavailable. I’ve had it for years now and no problems what so ever. It has various of speeds which is great. There are so many attachment for different projects. The only down fall like I said earlier is that it’s bulky and heavier then the corded other than that great tool to have.
customer_reviews.author: dion santos

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: great build quality. the product feels great and works even better. adjustable speed control is fluid and actuates very smoothly. battery charger is standalone and works quickly. carrying case is well-laid out and rugged enough to keep everything in place despite a little throwing around. attachments are...good. almost victim of the motor as they sometimes get spun too fast. other complaint is battery life. be ready to take many charging breaks if you'll be using high rpm for an extended period of time! or pick up another battery.
customer_reviews.author: gus

customer_reviews.title: Works well but possible switch issue
customer_reviews.text: Like this tool a lot. After lite use for a year I’m starting to have a little issue with the on/off switch. I have to jiggle a bit to get it to come on. Not sure how long it will last. Charge life is pretty good.r
customer_reviews.author: Doral Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Free from the Cord at Last!
customer_reviews.text: Working very well. While the Lithium Ion battery charge holds up well I'm glad I got this with the extra battery. It came with a nice sample selection of accessories. The case is well designed and practical to hold an adequate base complement of accessories. A second case/box should be used as a larger long term storage cache. Dremel sells some larger accessory kits that provide good portable storage. I am using this to support wood carving. The 3/4 -12 treaded nose, typical of most rotary tools, fits my Veritas Plunge Base and its wonderful not to have the cord catching everything as I move around the project.
customer_reviews.author: GlenT

customer_reviews.title: Portability
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job, but I found it do be somewhat heavy to work and too large to get into tight spaces. The power switch is very difficult to use and the batteries are hard to get in and out. It’s almost like the spaces they fit into are just a bit too tight. I would have returned it, but I needed it right away for a very challenging project.
customer_reviews.author: Meticulous

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! So versatile. The settings can be gentle enough for fine work but powerful enough for tough jobs. Easy to hold. Not too much vibration. You can buy tons of accessories for it too. The photo attached is to show you that it can drill holes in seashells without breaking them. (Don't breath in the seashell dust).
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C.

customer_reviews.title: Lithium technology is great
customer_reviews.text: After I consulted a friend who is a Dremel expert and writes Dremel reviews—he had advised against buying this model that he deemed too bulky and noisy—I still bought one and found it ABSOLUTELY SUPERB. It is somewhat larger than the corded variety but it's utility with the lithium battery is worth the size difference. The tool's noise is no way objectionable. One advice: buy a spare battery and have it charged while you are working!
customer_reviews.author: Azazello

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I use it mostly for trimming plastic parts and car bodies for RC cars. It is so much better than the 7700 model I had before, which was a bit weak and didn't hold a charge for very long, especially after a couple of years of use. This one is very powerful and has a long lasting battery (2 of them if you get the -2 model). If only I had gotten this one in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Yoy only get 1 battery. I think they have a package with 2 batteries.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I was concerned about the battery but I have used it once to modify door jamb and it stayed charged with time to spare. It was also plenty powerful enough to cut thru door strike plate metal with ease. I'm glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Harley man

customer_reviews.title: The ultimate cordless tool for hobbies.
customer_reviews.text: I have black and decker RTX and needed cordless one to equal its performance. This Dermel 8220 does the job. I think it has no equal in the competition. I highly recommend for any one with a hobby. It is built with precision and high quality material. I bought powerextra battery B812-03 3.0 AH 12Volt max lithium-ion replacementa battery which fits nicely in the tool and charger at half the price of the original.
customer_reviews.author: Darbyvienna

customer_reviews.title: Tough Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to grip and hold. Very versatile. If the 12V battery lasted longer, it would have earned 5 stars across the board. The remedy for longer jobs of course, is to have one or more extra batteries on hand, depending on the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs just like the plug in version
customer_reviews.text: I had some concern that the cordless Dremel would not run as strong as the corded version but it does. My issue - resulting 4 vs 5 stars is the battery included in this package. The run time is way short of my expectation. Fortunately I bought a non-Dremel spare with twice the amp hour capacity and use that as a primary.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Good to have around the house
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They are great to have around the house for small jobs. They are perfect for small jobs on light plastic. Not for heavy work like cutting steel or wood. The battery will deplete quickly when trying to cut thick wood or steel. But on light plastics, the battery lasts long and it does a good job.
customer_reviews.author: John in Kenya

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: This Dremel was to replace another Dremel that was over used. This one has more features and works great. Love the battery power so you don't have to fuss with power chords. We've been using this tool for quite a while now and still works great!
customer_reviews.author: SoCoEnvy

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITELY BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: This handheld powerhouse is friggin amazing. I bought it to strip some old couplings off of some parts and it tore through them like they were butter. Battery is legit, and overall the unit has really good weight to it. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Egan

customer_reviews.title: Steady grinding device for fine electrical switch cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Unencumbered with an AC cord, this device excels in allowing the user to do fine small grinding in tight places such as old switch stacks on pre 1978 pinball machines.
customer_reviews.author: redcloudjl

customer_reviews.title: Great for trimming dog nails!
customer_reviews.text: I have 120 grit sanders and use this to trim dog nails. I had the pet version of this dremel before and had to charge the battery before I could finish three dogs. Not anymore! This bad boy stays charged through several nail trims of three dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for Dogs Nails
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to dremel my dog's nails at home. It's easy to use, and is stronger and more durable than the one's that are sold at pet stores. And since I no longer have to pay a groomer to trim my pup's nails, I'm saving quite a bit of money.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: bought it for my son for his birthday, and he loves it! uses it to grind, polish, and cut just about everything in site! also has lots of attachments you can buy to do just about anything you need to do.
customer_reviews.author: dasize34

customer_reviews.title: agile and handy
customer_reviews.text: This little cordless Dremel has power and is very agile. I have used it to cut sheet rock and rusty nail heads in tight places. Battery appears to hold up well. moulded case is very well done. I would recommend also purchasing the accessory kit as this unit does not come with many attachments. The shaft lock button is easy to engage and makes swapping heads easy and quick. I now find many uses for this handy little tool
customer_reviews.author: FR W.

customer_reviews.title: These are great tools!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a cordless dremel for ever! I literally wore out the motor bearings in my first and actually found a brand new motor assembly for $15.00. Repaired it and works as good as new, but I decided to purchase a new one anyways. I love it to. And the fact that you have a separate on / off switch now and a slider for speed is excellent. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Best Dremel in years
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many cordless Dremels through the years, which I use for filing down my dogs toenails. This model is my favorite so far. Works well, fairly quiet, the battery slides in smoothly, and easy to change the different parts. I have two Golden Retrievers, one that hates having her toenails clipped. When I discovered the Dremel, we've never looked back. She is great about me filing down her nails with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly to trim my dogs nail since there black and you can’t see the vain, I have since then used this for various home repair and I love that it’s cordless and seems to handle the power so far
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Love the 2 batteries
customer_reviews.text: How I spent 58 years without it🤣 Unfortunately I m having lately problems with battery/switch/ charger? Tool will not start or start and than die very quickly.. after a couple of seconds. I fully recharged batteries (2 hours charge) and the same problem. I have to pull out the battery ,reinsert it and than it may start or not. Very disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: R. Zi

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used today. Working on my honda ruckus. Cutting off taillight bracket/metal. Smooth easy fast. Another great buy n useful tool to have. Had a hard time deciding battery or cord operated. I feel either way u can't go wrong. I just like the mobility it gives me. This tool is highly recommended for weekend mechanic guy. Price worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this 'little' guy
customer_reviews.text: I got this 2 days ago and have been using ever since. I've used it with the flex tool and the Dremel work station. I used to cut some 5\/16 steel bolts off and had no problem. It works good with all the Tools I have for it. If you use the right attachments, cutting wheels, sanding discs, or whatever, this powerful 12-V Dremel can do the job!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Spratley

customer_reviews.title: Very handy, plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Handy supplement to my corded Dremel. Seems just about as powerful, battery lasts a long time on a charge (same 12V lithium battery as my Bosch tools!), plus the obvious convenience of cordlessness.
customer_reviews.author: Indep Museum Tech

customer_reviews.title: Charges quickly and the accessories are great.
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described and arrived safely and quickly. However, I find it more difficult to use than I expected as a small female it gets heavy quickly. Charges quickly and the accessories are great.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: So many uses, this tool is great!
customer_reviews.text: I find all types of new uses for this great little tool. I use to take my dog to the groomer for nail trimming until I saw them using a similar tool to a Dremel. Not that I bought this for the purpose of doing my dog’s nail, but now it seems I use it for that more than other projects 😂
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DAmico

customer_reviews.title: husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know anything about the Dremel tools, so I just picked the one that had good features and a bunch of accessories. I did good! My husband about hit the floor when I gave it to him for his birthday. He said "oh man! this is the good one!" He's used it multiple times already in just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life. Comes with one collet size only.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to drill 400-500 holes through 3/4" MDF (1mm drill bit) on one battery charge. This tool is simply amazing. Keep in mind that this kit does NOT come with different collet sizes and you need a trip to Home Depot to pick up a collet kit for ~$7 in order for the dremel tool to accept 0.75mm - 1.5mm drill bits.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Battery Dead After a Few Months
customer_reviews.text: This Dremel is awesome! Too bad the rechargeable batteries are not. Purchased this Dremel late March 2020 and after less than 6 months, one battery no longer works or charges. I've messaged Dremel support in the hopes this may be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: TerriG

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I already have three Dremels but felt the need for a cordless model. Yeah, I know.... Anyway, going cordless was a great purchase. I probably won't use my corded units again. That said, I really wish they included a slot in the body for the wrench. I used to attach the wrench to the cord but....
customer_reviews.author: U2

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought less less than a year ago. I go to use it again and tool says the battery is dead. No problem, only the charger thinks it’s fully charged. So either way I have to PAY to ship everything back to them, and hope they actually fix it for free. Still out the cost of the shipping, thanks for the terrible product, guys!
customer_reviews.author: RallyBlueRex

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and I agree you can't have too many ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and I agree you can't have too many Dremel Rotary Tools. She needed to replace one so I got this one for her for Christmas. Of course Daddy is responsible for checking out all toys to make sure they work before they go under the tree. This is a 5 star tool but large and heavy for detail work. However, the Li-Ion battery provides more charge life with less weight. The second battery means you can keep going even longer, if not continuously. I am getting her the detailers grip for her hobby work.
customer_reviews.author: Wayneka

customer_reviews.title: Yep, it's a Dremel.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to hold, but a bit too big for intricate work. That being said, you can attach a flex shaft to this bad boy and problem solved! It's basically a Dremel 4000 without the cord - if that's what you're looking for, this is what you want to have.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Decimal
